A housing initiative has been announced to provide low cost financing for housing units. A government guarantee of EGP 3 billion on low-interest loans by the central bank has been announce for the tourism industry soft loans. Implementation date: 25-03-20  Many measures have been introduced to support SMEs and employees, at an estimated cost of 2% of the Tunisian GDP. The details are set out in the attached document, and are briefly summarised below.    TAX MEASURES    1. Postponing the Tax filing of the corporate income Tax (CIT) until the end of May 2020, excluding companies submitted to the rate of 35%.  2. Suspending all tax controls and all deadlines related to tax review procedures and objections until the end of May 2020.  3. Enabling all companies to recover Tax credits by accelerating the frequency of the refund committee meetings.  4. Activating the role of the National Committee and the regional reconciliation committees.  5. Revaluing real estate propriety recorded in the balance sheet according to its fair value.  6. Extending the deadline for the payment of vehicle circulation tax to the end of April 2020.  7. Amnesty for customs penalties.    FINANCE MEASURES    1. Creating a 500 million dinars investment fund to support permanent resources for companies that maintain jobs.  2. Creating a 100 million dinars investment fund with to repurchase capital shares of investment funds on companies operating in strategic sectors and having difficulties.  3. Creation of a monitoring and supporting unit to take care of companies most affected by the repercussions of the coronavirus.  4. Enabling affected companies to schedule their tax debts for a period of up to 7 years.  5. Enabling affected companies to suspend penalties related to late filing or a period of 3 months from 1 April to 30 June 2020.  6. Facilitating to these companies the procedures of recovering “VAT Credit”.  7. Enabling affected companies to obtain certificates of VAT & other taxes exemption and other fiscal certificates on written demand without delivering the required documents.  8. Launching a new mechanism to guarantee new operating loans provided by banks until December 31, 2020, to the tourism, transport, and other affected sectors.  9. Additional 300 million dinars funding to support existing financial facilities in supporting and promoting SMEs.  10. Implementing measures for the State to sponsor the difference between investment loans interest rate and the average interest rate in the financial market within 3 points for SMEs.  11. Investment mechanism to finance the purchase of equipment for hospitals and public health institutions.  12. VAT exemption for companies operating in the retailing and wholesaling of medicines.   13. Allowing fully exporting companies operating in the food and health industries to increase their sales ratio in the local market from 30% to 100% during 2020.  14. Allowing other fully exporting companies to increase their sales ratio in the local market from 30% to 50% during 2020.  15. Creating a fund to push the cultural sector and help companies and projects face the difficulties due to the cancellation of shows & cultural events.  16. Companies with public agreements which are blocked by COVID-19 are exempt from delay penalties for up to 6 months.  17.
